definition: to think highly of oneself
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: IN 1887 physicists were feeling pretty smug about their subject.
sentences.chinese: 1887年物理學家們對自己的學科都頗爲自鳴得意。

sentences.english: Thus the fool, as compared with the scoundrel, is invariably self-complacent.
sentences.chinese: 所以同惡棍相比，蠢人總是自鳴得意。

sentences.english: Here we are in danger of smugly supposing superiority.
sentences.chinese: 自我感覺優越並自鳴得意，這樣的假設是很危險的。

sentences.english: When Arivama was getting smug over it Kira thanked him.
sentences.chinese: 正當他自鳴得意時，吉良開始感謝他。

sentences.english: They will clap themselves for gaining tuppence and giving a million away to their enemies.
sentences.chinese: 卻把一百萬都輸了給敵人，還會爲此而自鳴得意呢。

sentences.english: A stark word of warning for self-satisfied designers everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 這是對那些自鳴得意的設計者的警告。

sentences.english: But this is no time for complacency.
sentences.chinese: 但是沒有時間自鳴得意。

sentences.english: They get lazy, complacent, and self-satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 他們變的懶惰，自滿，自鳴得意。

sentences.english: He is always proud of his so called refinement in manners.
sentences.chinese: 他總是爲他所謂的高雅舉止自鳴得意。

sentences.english: Nor can the rest of the world look on smugly at Europe’s woes.
sentences.chinese: 世界其它國家也不能看着歐洲的災難而自鳴得意。

sentences.english: The smug guy with the beer and the cigarette?
sentences.chinese: 那些拿着啤酒香菸的自鳴得意的傢伙呢？

sentences.english: Medea flees the scene, smug in the success of her deception.
sentences.chinese: 而美狄亞爲着自己成功的騙術而自鳴得意着逃離了。

sentences.english: He always says something with cock-a-hoop.
sentences.chinese: 他說話時經常一副自鳴得意的樣子。

sentences.english: Nationalism is a silly cock crow on it own dunghill.
sentences.chinese: 民族主義，是在自己的小天地裏自鳴得意的雄雞。

sentences.english: He is always proud of his so-called refinement in manners.
sentences.chinese: 他總是爲他所謂有高雅舉止自鳴得意。

sentences.english: The problem with most compa-nies is complacency.
sentences.chinese: 自鳴得意是大多數公司的通病。

definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
willingly and gladly (idiom)
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to haggle over every cent (idiom)
clan/race
from the start/absolutely/entirely/simply
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: daring/presumptuous/daredevil
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
enigmatic/beyond one's depth/unfathomable
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
